content: meridian by annie baker jumpercablesknitting com meridian is an asymmetric scarf design ideal for using solid and multicolored fingering weight yarns together in one project knit on the bias this pattern features eyelets and lots of garter stitch size is adjustable just use more yarn for a larger scarf sample scarf shown on us size 12 dress form enjoy materials minimum 368 meters / 400 yards miss babs hot shot fingering weight yarn in solid colorway lurch minimum 184 meters / 200 yards miss babs hot shot fingering weight yarn in multi-colorway whimsical 3 25mm us3 / uk10 knitting needles gauge not crucial 26 stitches in garter stitch = 4 inches measurements approximate before blocking 13 inches deep 48 inches across neck edge after blocking 15 inches deep 58 inches across neck edge notes  you can increase the number of repeats for either section and knit a larger scarf  if you would like to add more color sections separate each section with eyelets beginning with row 7  you may also use dk weight yarns and 4 00mm us6 / uk8 needles for a thicker scarf ©copyright 2015 annie baker all rights reserved this pattern may be used for non-commercial personal use only it slip one stitch knitwise k2tog = knit next two stitches together kfb = knit into front and back of next stitch st s = stitch es instructions with solid color yarn cast on 4 stitches proceed to row 1 row 1 sl1 k2tog k to last st kfb row 2 kfb k to end row 3 sl1 k2tog k to last st kfb row 4 kfb k to end row 5 sl1 k to last st kfb row 6 kfb k to end repeat row 1 to 6 forty times more proceed to row 7 row 7 sl1 k2tog k2tog yo to last 3 sts k to last st kfb with multicolor yarn proceed as follows row 8 kfb k to end row 9 sl1 k2tog k to last st kfb row 10 kfb k to end row 11 sl1 k to last st kfb row 12 kfb k to end work row 1 to 6 seven or more times leaving enough yarn for cast off row cast off loosely as follows k1 k2tog pass first st over second st on right needle k1 pass first st over second st on right needle repeat to end pull yarn through wet block as follows after dampening scarf gently stretch neck edge and pin straight smooth out and pin at bottom point and bottom edges allow
